class_notes: The delivery format listed for this class is based on current university guidelines.  However, if there are further changes to the COVID19 guidelines for Fall 2021 or other acts beyond our control, the school reserves the right the modify the delivery method for this class
course_description: This course provides coverage of social network analysis with a primary focus on recent developments in theory, methods and substantive applications. The primary topics to be covered in this course include the application of network theory to the study of careers, competition, innovation, inequality/stratification, IT-mediated networks, network formation, and network dynamics. Students will gain hands-on experience applying social network methods in empirical research. Students will have an opportunity to learn some modern network analysis methods and apply them to network data.
prerequisites: This section is reserved for students in the MSBA program.
